docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of police officers broke up an anti-Kremlin protest in Moscow and detained dozens of people, including a recipient of the European Union’s top human rights award.
docs.snippet: Hundreds of police officers broke up an anti-Kremlin protest in Moscow and detained dozens of people, including a recipient of the European Union’s top human rights award.

docs.lead_paragraph: The police say that the video, which appears to show a police pickup truck running over a protester, was faked and that no deaths were reported in that area.

headline.main: Video of Attack on Protester Is a Fake, Iranian Police Say
headline.print_headline: Video of Attack on Protester Is a Fake, Iranian Police Say

docs.snippet: The police say that the video, which appears to show a police pickup truck running over a protester, was faked and that no deaths were reported in that area.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cartoon versions of Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin and President Dmitri A. Medvedev on a television show may be a sign that political humor is returning to Russia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Security forces filled Tehran streets to deter protests, as the opposition leader said he did not fear to give his life to his cause.

headline.seo: Iran Stages Show of Force as Moussavi Denounces Government

headline.print_headline: Iran Leaders Stage Show of Force as Standoff Escalates

docs.lead_paragraph: Roger Cohen has suggested that "doing nothing" is the best policy toward Iran. A wise position until the recent demonstrations. Now, it is time for the international community to take action.

headline.content_kicker: Letters to the International Herald Tribune

docs.snippet: Roger Cohen has suggested that "doing nothing" is the best policy toward Iran. A wise position until the recent demonstrations. Now, it is time for the international community to take action.

docs.lead_paragraph: Russia’s cheapest thrill disappeared at dawn on Friday, when the minimum price for a half-liter of vodka nearly doubled as part of an anti-alcoholism campaign.

headline.main: In Russia, a New Year and a New Price for Vodka
headline.print_headline: In Russia, a New Year and a New Price for Vodka

docs.lead_paragraph: Iran’s foreign minister said the country could begin further enriching its nuclear stockpile on its own.

headline.print_headline: Iran Gives West One-Month ‘Ultimatum’ to Accept Nuclear Counterproposal

docs.snippet: Iran’s foreign minister said the country could begin further enriching its nuclear stockpile on its own.

docs.lead_paragraph: Setbacks in its nuclear program and protests in the streets are making Iran’s leaders vulnerable to strong new sanctions, the Obama administration says.

headline.sub: Analysts Cite Domestic Unrest and Setbacks in Secret Program;

docs.lead_paragraph: The two countries failed to renew an agreement on crude oil export tariffs that expired on New Year’s Eve, raising the prospect of another midwinter fuel shut-off.

docs.lead_paragraph: Five days of blizzards and avalanches cut off air and sea links to the mainland, stranded dozens of motorists on highways, and even buried a train.
